objects.name: CMGT_NCF_orderNodesBasedOnDistanceFromStart
objects.description:
To be used inside reduce.
Given a list of nodes already ordered, a list of all nodes, and a list of relationships between nodes, finds nodes which are only dependent on already sorted nodes, updates their "order" based on their parents' maximum order, and appends them to the list of ordered nodes

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_orderNodesHorizontallyBottomUp
objects.description:
To be used inside reduce.
Given a level, a list of nodes already ordered, a list of all nodes, and a list of relationships between nodes, associates nodes on the level to their dependent nodes and orders them based on the average horizontal order of their dependents. Doing this order from the bottom first helps alleviate poor formatting that can remain after a top-down sort that is the result of ambiguity from just sorting on precedents.

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_orderNodesHorizontallyTopDown
objects.description:
To be used inside reduce.
Given a level, a list of nodes already ordered, a list of all nodes, and a list of relationships between nodes, associates nodes on the level given to their precedent nodes and orders them based on the average horizontal order of their precedents.

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_setAverageHorizontalOrderOfDependents
objects.description:
Given a node, all edges, and a list of ordered nodes, associates a node with its dependents and sets the node's horizontalOrder based on the average of its dependents.
This function is needed because foreach() is not allowed inside reduce().

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_setAverageHorizontalOrderOfPrecedents
objects.description:
Given a node, all edges, and a list of ordered nodes, associates a node with its precedents and sets the node's horizontalOrder based on the average of its precedents.
This function is needed because foreach() is not allowed inside reduce().

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_updateNodeHorizontalOrderFromIndex
objects.description:
Given a node and a list of sorted nodes, returns a relative position of the current node as a percentage of the screen to the left of the node. For example, a set of 3 nodes would return 25, 50, and 75 to try to spread them out a bit.
This function is needed because foreach() is not allowed inside reduce().

objects.name: CMGT_NCF_updateNodeOrderBasedOnPrecedents
objects.description:
Given a single node as well as a list of all edges, a list of all ordered nodes, and a list of all edges to unordered nodes, determines:
1. if there are no required precedents AND no sorted precedents
2. if there are no required precedents AND any sorted precedents
3. if there are required precedents AND any are not already sorted
4. if there are required precedents AND all are already sorted

For 2 and 4, updates the order of the given node to the max of the precedents' order +1. Otherwise returns nothing so the node can be processed later on.

objects.name: CMGT_NetworkChartField_FixNodeEdgeOrder_Logic
objects.description: Does a bunch of custom logic to reorder/manipulate the nodes and edges to try and optimize the rendering algorithm layout

objects.name: CMGT_NetworkChartField_StandardFormatting

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_Distinct
objects.description: Returns the distinct values from a list

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_DistinctRecords
objects.description: Returns distinct records based on certain field(s). For example, passing in fields A and B would return a list of records that have collectively distinct values for A & B. When handling duplicates, the first record in the input list is returned.

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_Filter
objects.description: Filters, rejects, or returns matching indices of a list of records by field-value filter combinations.

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_IsBlank
objects.description: Evaluates if the provided value is empty/blank. Returns True or False.

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_IsMobileScreenSize
objects.description: Returns true if the current screen size is either PHONE or TABLET_PORTRAIT

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_IsNotBlank
objects.description: A not() wrapped around CMGT_UTIL_IsBlank

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_LoadBrandingMap

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_MergeMaps
objects.description: Merges two maps together, prioritizing map2 over map1 where two values collide

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_RejectBlank
objects.description: Rule to removes null values from an array of primitive types or CDTs (for CDT the index must be null, not each field)

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_ReplaceArgs
objects.description: Replaces arguments in a text string

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_TruncateText
objects.description: Truncates given text to a specified number of characters

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_cast
objects.description: Casts a variable to the type of either the input `type`, or the typeof of the input `typeof`, and properly handles for null inputs

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_checkIfSingleType
objects.description: Returns true if the `type` or `typeOf` inputs represent a singular, non-array type

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_returnLastIndexOfArray
objects.description: Returns the last index of an array, or a null value if the array is empty

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_returnSingleTypeObject
objects.description: Takes in either an array type or a primitive type and returns the singular type object, works for CDTs or primitive types

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_returnTypeNumber
objects.description: Returns the typeNumber of either `type` or `typeOf`

objects.name: CMGT_UTIL_sortList
objects.description: Sorts a list of record, CDT, dictionary, or complex type.  Pass nullsFirst to explicitly sort nulls first or last.
